snippet.title: Legoland Malaysia miniaturizes Asian icons
snippet.description: With 40 rides and attractions, Legoland Malaysia opened over the weekend as the first of its kind in Asia. Here's a look at the new paradise of bricks.

snippet.title: Missed connections: Limbo in high tech's culture clash
snippet.description: The term "Google bus" has come to symbolize very real tensions between tech companies and the communities they call home. Here's a look below the surface.

snippet.title: Apple's culture of secrecy delays security response -- again
snippet.description: Apple finally delivers a cure for the "goto fail" plague, but this isn't the first time that sluggish Apple response times have put its users at risk.

snippet.title: How tech's culture war feeds the art of the outrageous
snippet.description: If the clash between Silicon Valley and the nontech community is indeed "class warfare," as some have suggested, then there's an arms race for shock value.

snippet.title: CNET Road Trip 2013: Geek culture in America's heartland
snippet.description: Ride with CNET's Daniel Terdiman as he explores some of the best geek-oriented spots throughout Illinois, Ohio, Michigan, Missouri, Indiana, Wisconsin, and Nebraska.

snippet.title: LG's G Pro 2 sales spread to big Asian markets
snippet.description: The large 5.9-inch phone expands to some big Asian markets like Indonesia and Singapore, but LG Electronics still won't commit to North American or European sales.

snippet.title: Silicon Valley's app culture eroding US ability to make serious software
snippet.description: [Q&A] Decidedly old school and proud of it, Pegasystems CEO Alan Trefler says the current app culture has abandoned the concept of customer-centricity with serious consequences for the US' ability to make software.

snippet.title: Mario, Coke -- Angry Birds? Rovio eyes pop culture pantheon
snippet.description: Game maker Rovio says it will keep making spinoffs of its popular Angry Birds franchise "just like Nintendo and its series of Mario-based games."

snippet.title: #Hashtags: Facebook's missing link to pop culture
snippet.description: The # symbol has become the key to connecting to people and events you care about on social media. It's also an obvious hole for Facebook.

snippet.title: Facebook adds hashtags, mends missing link to pop culture
snippet.description: The social network bends to support a mainstream mode of digital expression popularized by a competitor.
